subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Why does 1 digital recorder capture EVP over another
author: April Abercrombie
full_text:
------=_NextPart_000_0059_01C9F4A0.62467860
Content-Type: text/plain;
	charset="iso-8859-1"
Content-Transfer-Encoding: quoted-printable

I would call that pretty good evidence right there.

  ----- Original Messa=
ge ----- 
  From: Zack Widup 
  To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
  Sent: Wednes=
day, June 24, 2009 7:46 AM
  Subject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Why does 1 digital reco=
rder capture EVP over another






  Interesting topic!

  BTW that invest=
igation was at the former Manteno State Mental Hospital. It included the am=
azing "It's Harold Wing" EVP I got. None of the people doing the investigat=
ion there had ever heard of Harold Wing. Upon later examination of old reco=
rds, it was found that Harold Wing was actually a patient who died there of=
 typhoid fever in 1938. But we didn't find that out until weeks later.

  H=
ow do you explain that conventionally?
  :-)

  Zack

   
  On Wed, Jun 24,=
 2009 at 8:36 AM, April Abercrombie <april@...> wr=
ote:





    A similar thing happened to me on our last investigation too.=


      ----- Original Message ----- 
      From: Zack Widup 
      To: EVP=
-ITC@yahoogroups.com 
      Sent: Wednesday, June 24, 2009 7:19 AM
      Su=
bject: Re: [EVP-ITC] Why does 1 digital recorder capture EVP over another

=


      There's another possibility: possibly the spirits involved only wis=
h to impart sounds to a particular unit or units.

      I was surprised on=
 one investigation I was on to get mostly all the same EVP on my DVR, which=
 was hanging from my belt, and my camcorder, which was in front of my face.=
 Other people on the investigation didn't get them at all. Go figure! 
    =
  :-)

      Zack


      On Tue, Jun 23, 2009 at 3:26 PM, Rj <rasterer@yah=
oo.com> wrote:




              There could be several reasons, and it's o=
nly conjecture without comparing the two specific units in questions.  But =
some ideas:

              1) The battery level on one is different than th=
e other, and causing one to function less optimally and introduce noise or =
artifacts into the stream.
              2) They were not actually 'sitting=
' side by side, but being swung around.
              3) They are pointed a=
t different areas
              4) One may be older than the other or have =
been dropped a few times.
              5) One may have been recently expos=
ed to extreme humidity or temperatures, while the other remained in a comfo=
rtable environment, before doing this recording
              6) One may be=
 sitting in a position more subject by airflow or vibrations
              =
7) They may use different memory cards. that have different error or accura=
cy profiles
              8) The final sound files may have been processed =
differently in various software programs
              9) People in the roo=
m may be nearer and moving closer to one than the other
              10) T=
hey may simply be two different models with different recording sensitives =
and limitations



              --- On Tue, 6/23/09, lechevar2000 <lecheva=
r@...> wrote:


                From: lechevar2000 <lechevar@verizo=
n.net>
                Subject: [EVP-ITC] Why does 1 digital recorder captu=
re EVP over another
                To: EVP-ITC@yahoogroups.com
           =
     Date: Tuesday, June 23, 2009, 5:57 AM 



                Hi, 
       =
         I believe I saw an explaination on this list about why if you have=
 2 recorders sitting side by side, why may one capture an EVP on one and no=
t the other? Someone was explaining about an energy field like a bubble. 
 =
               I'm trying to explain this theory to a friend. Can someone h=
elp me? 
                Thanks Laura
